schema.description: Port CRC error alarm.

port-name.description: This object indicates the name of a physical port.

physical-port-crc-error-statistics.description: This object indicates the CRC error statistics.

physical-port-crc-error-high-threshold.description: This object indicates the upper threshold for the number of CRC errors. The default value is 1000 pps.

physical-port-crc-error-low-threshold.description: This object indicates the lower threshold for the number of CRC errors. The default value is 100 pps.

physical-port-crc-error-interval.description: This object indicates the time threshold for the CRC error alarm. The default value is 10s.

physical-port-crc-error-interval.description: This object indicates the time threshold for the CRC error alarm. The default value is 10s.

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the number of CRC errors on a physical port exceeds the upper threshold. The host sends a trap message to the NMS.

port-name.description: This object indicates the name of a physical port.

current-crc-packet-error-ratio.description: This object indicates that the thresholds for CRC error packet ratio alarms on a physical port are sent to the NMS in the character string format.

alarm-threshold.description: This object indicates that the generation threshold for the CRC error packet ratio alarm on a physical port is sent to the NMS in the character string format.

resume-threshold.description: This object indicates that the clearing threshold for the CRC error packet ratio clear alarm on a physical port is sent to the NMS in the character string format.

schema.description: This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the number of CRC errors on a physical port falls below the upper threshold. The host sends a trap message to the NMS.

alarm-threshold.description: This object indicates that the generation threshold for the CRC error packet ratio alarm on a physical port is sent to the NMS in the character string format.

resume-threshold.description: This object indicates that the clearing threshold for the CRC error packet ratio clear alarm on a physical port is sent to the NMS in the character string format.

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the number of CRC errors on a physical port exceeds the lower threshold. The host sends a trap message to the NMS.

physical-port-index.description: This object indicates the index of a physical port.

port-name.description: This object indicates the name of a physical port.

current-crc-packet-error-ratio.description: This object indicates that the thresholds for CRC error packet ratio alarms on a physical port are sent to the NMS in the character string format.

crc-per-warning-threshold.description: The warning threshold of CRC-PER (Packet Error Ratio).

physical-port-crc-per-warning-resume-thr.description: The warning resume threshold of CRC-PER (Packet Error Ratio).

schema.description: This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the number of CRC errors on a physical port falls below the lower threshold. The host sends a trap message to the NMS.

physical-port-index.description: This object indicates the index of a physical port.

port-name.description: This object indicates the name of a physical port.

current-crc-packet-error-ratio.description: This object indicates that the thresholds for CRC error packet ratio alarms on a physical port are sent to the NMS in the character string format.

physical-port-crc-per-warning-threshold.description: The warning threshold of CRC-PER (Packet Error Ratio).

physical-port-crc-per-warning-resume-thr.description: The warning resume threshold of CRC-PER (Packet Error Ratio).

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm when port FCS signal degrade at the MAC layer.

physical-port-index.description: This object indicates the index of a physical port.

port-name.description: This object indicates the name of a physical port.

current-crc-packet-error-ratio.description: This object indicates that the thresholds for CRC error packet ratio alarms on a physical port are sent to the NMS in the character string format.

schema.description: This object indicates that a clear alarm when port FCS signal degrade at the MAC layer.

physical-port-index.description: This object indicates the index of a physical port.

port-name.description: This object indicates the name of a physical port.

current-crc-packet-error-ratio.description: This object indicates that the thresholds for CRC error packet ratio alarms on a physical port are sent to the NMS in the character string format.

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm is generated when path trace identifiers between the local and remote ends mismatch.
This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when path trace identifiers between the local and remote ends match.
The transmission modes of the group of interfaces are inconsistent.

physical-port-groupid.description: Indicates the physical port group id.

port-trans-mode-reason.description: Indicates the physical port transmission mode different reason.

schema.description: The transmission modes of the group of interfaces are consistent now.

physical-port-groupid.description: Indicates the physical port group id.

port-trans-mode-reason.description: Indicates the physical port transmission mode different reason.

schema.description: This object indicates that the port rate type is changed.

physical-port-mode.description: The current state of port type in port.

schema.description: One of the port physical connect down.

base-trap-severity.description: To describe the level of trap.

base-trap-probable-cause.description: To describe the probable cause of trap.

base-trap-event-type.description: To describe the type of trap.

schema.description: One of the port physical connect up.

base-trap-severity.description: To describe the level of trap.

base-trap-probable-cause.description: To describe the probable cause of trap.

base-trap-event-type.description: To describe the type of trap.

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the negotiation rate on an electrical interface falls sharply.
This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the negotiation rate on an electrical interface falls sharply.
Traffic fall alarm in the receive direction of an Ethernet interface.
Traffic fall clear alarm in the receive direction of an Ethernet interface.
The mode of combo port is changed.

physical-port-mode.description: The current state of port type in port.

schema.description: This object indicates the higher order path (HP) signal identifier mismatch.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates that the higher order path (HP) signal identifier mismatch is rectified.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates the higher order path (HP) Remote Default Indication (HPRDI) alarm.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates the higher order path (HP) Remote Default Indication (HPRDI) alarm is cleared.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm is generated for forward error correction (FEC) bit errors threshold-crossing.
This object indicates that a clear is generated for forward error correction (FEC) bit errors threshold-crossing.
This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the higher order path (HP) trace identifier is unstable.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the higher order path (HP) trace identifier becomes stable.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the higher order path (HP) is unequipped.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the higher order path (HP) is equipped.

hp-id.description: Indicates the higher order path ID.

schema.description: The peer end was faulty.
The peer end recovered from faults.
This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the transmit link from the remote device to the local device fails.
This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the transmit link from the remote device to the local device recovers.
This object indicates the signal degrade in the multiplex section B2.
This object indicates that the alarm for the signal degrade in the multiplex section B2 is cleared.
This object indicates that an alarm is generated when the section frame alignment between the local and remote ends is incorrect.
This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when the section frame alignment error between the local and remote ends is corrected.
This object indicates that an alarm is generated when TIM trace identifiers between the local and remote ends mismatch.
This object indicates that a clear alarm is generated when TIM trace identifiers between the local and remote ends match.
